habitat_description:
In Texas, this species occurs in Terrell and Pecos counties and into the Chihuahuan Desert. It can be found near live oaks growing in canyons or edges of moist canyons (Werler and Dixon 2000). The range of this species extends from western Louisiana, southwestern Arkansas into western and south Texas. This species also occurs south into Mexico, populations occur in Guanajuato and Morelos (Campbell and Lamar 2004, Dundee and Rossman 1989, Trauth et al. 2004).

GP-	(Texas into Mexico) Tall grass prairie, riparian woodland, rocky creek banks, sandy grass, mesquite, thorn forest, oak savanna, and pine/oak forest.

SE	-(Arkansas and Louisiana) Forested areas, subtropical thornscrub, gardens, wooded lots, undeveloped parklands in cities, and cross-timber woodland.
